snippet: The problem is quite real. Errors can drive up borrowing costs for consumers, and cause them to be denied jobs or turned away by landlords.
abstract: Editorial highlights Federal Trade Commission study that finds credit reports contain widespread errors, allegation that companies that compile and sell such reports have often dismissed; calls on federal government to do more to make credit-reporting process transparent and to protect consumers.
lead_paragraph: The problem is quite real. Errors can drive up borrowing costs for consumers, and cause them to be denied jobs or turned away by landlords.
